item.title: Repeated flytipping attracting foxes and rodents, 25th July
item.description:
This neighbour continues to leave trash unaccompanied for several days on our communal walkway This recent flytipping of general waste has attracted foxes and rodents to tear through the trash and leave debris and waste everywhere

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 153, Tower Bridge Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Single gully AND curb drainage FAILING to protect the CP Subway from flooding above the bridge after NORMAL rainfall, 25th July
item.description:
As requested, this issue has recured during normal rainfall, issue is now raised under a new report and for Bromley to re-investigate with a view to arranging remedial cleansing works. Single gully AND its ACO Kirbdrain system drainage system FAILING to protect the CP Subway from flooding over the bridge after NORMAL rainfall on 24th July 2025. The issued was raised under but closed as the rainfall not considered "normal". https://fix.bromley.gov.uk/report/7904303 The highway gullies at this location have been inspected after NORMAL and typical rainfall , and found to be non functioning with WIDE and DEEP ponding over the parade road and footway that stayed as deep ponding for HOURS after rainfall has long stopped. Flooding is very slow to drain away once it gets this deep. Sustained surface flood water over the CP Subway means water seeps into the subway risking damage to the Grade II* road bridge structure. Single gully looks full of grit and sludge inside. Also, the ACO Kirbrdrain system needs jet washing as also has a lot of grit inside near this side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
